Abstract: This study presents an advanced multiplexing technology for proteomics, enabling the simultaneous analysis of thousands of proteins in a single experiment. By integrating hyperplexing and high-throughput techniques, our approach significantly enhances the efficiency and accuracy of protein identification and quantification. The proposed system utilizes advanced automation and machine learning algorithms to optimize sample preparation, data analysis, and result interpretation. Our results demonstrate a substantial increase in throughput and a reduction in experimental time, making this technology a valuable tool for large-scale proteomics studies. The implications of this work are far-reaching, with potential applications in fields such as personalized medicine, disease diagnosis, and drug discovery.
